[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Travel Booking System (TBS) defines requirements for trip planning, ticket reservations, accommodation booking, and itinerary management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: TBS enables users to search, book, modify, and manage travel services including transportation, accommodations, and payment processing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: TBS integrates with airline, train, and hotel reservation systems, travel insurance providers, and payment gateways.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: TBS provides a web-based and mobile UI with search, filtering, and real-time booking capabilities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: TBS supports barcode scanners for check-ins and integrates with self-service kiosks at stations and airports.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: TBS connects with third-party APIs for live ticket availability, travel package bundling, and currency exchange rates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: TBS ensures secure data exchanges using TLS encryption and supports email and SMS notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: TBS optimizes data storage for real-time reservations, past bookings, and payment histories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: TBS automates booking confirmations, itinerary generation, and travel expense tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: TBS supports multiple currencies, regional time zones, and multilingual interfaces.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: TBS connects with global transportation networks, hotel chains, and financial institutions.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: TBS provides travel search, ticket booking, accommodation management, trip modification, and itinerary tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: TBS serves individual travelers, travel agencies, business professionals, and tourism operators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: TBS depends on third-party travel service providers for real-time availability and pricing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: TBS relies on airline, train, and hotel partners for accurate booking and policy enforcement.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with global travel reservation networks to fetch real-time availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to search and compare transportation and accommodation options based on price, amenities, and ratings (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to book, modify, and cancel transportation and accommodation reservations, generating instant confirmations and refunds (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate travel itineraries with booking details, departure times, alerts for delays, and suggested activities (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer an interactive interface with predictive search, real-time filters, and easy booking navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall fetch search results within 3 seconds and process up to 1,000 concurrent bookings.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user bookings, payment history, travel preferences, and past itineraries.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with international travel data exchange standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to PCI DSS for payment security and GDPR for personal data protection.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure data encryption, secure transactions, and continuous uptime monitoring (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Booking accuracy checks, payment validation, and security audits.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API docs, and travel policies.
[SEC] 5. References: PCI DSS compliance, GDPR standards, and travel regulations.
